Translate scientific evidence into technical guidance, synthesize and analyse relevant datasets, and support Parties’ national reporting and drought‑preparedness measures.
Issue legally binding directives requiring Parties to implement specific early‑warning systems nationwide.

bullet_points.bullet_point_text: National Action Programmes (NAPs) are a central operational instrument of the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD), translating the Convention’s obligations into country‑specific, practical strategies to prevent and reverse land degradation and desertification; in a country like India—where land, water and livelihoods intersect tightly with domestic stability and cross‑border dynamics—NAPs function not merely as environmental plans but as elements of strategic policymaking that link sustainable land management to national security.

Establish a rigorous national M&E system focused on biophysical indicators and satellite monitoring to detect degradation early and adjust interventions centrally.

Design and implement locally tailored SLM packages, adopt participatory planning with local communities (including pastoral and indigenous knowledge), and engage in SRAP/RAP coordination with the neighbouring country to harmonize measures and share data.
